triples.evidence: To determine those two unknowns for each sinusoid - amplitude and phase - we need at least two data points per cycle.
the sampling rate - measured in samples per second - must be greater than 2 times nu.

concepts.term: sample fast enough to resolve the highest frequency present in the signal

triples.evidence: To avoid missing any important information, the spacing between adjacent samples must be less than or equal to 1 over 2 nu. In more familiar terms, that means the sampling rate - measured in samples per second - must be greater than 2 times nu. This is the famous Nyquist sampling rate.
